channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Donald Trump to suspend immigration to US, Australian death toll stands at 72 as COVID-19 cases near 2.5 million worldwide

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Wednesday, April 22

item.description: Follow our live coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Victoria considered bailing out Virgin Australia and moving its headquarters to Avalon airport as 10 potential bidders circle the collapsed airline.
item.title: Victoria considered Virgin rescue bid as 10 suitors circle the airline

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Residents took to social media to post photos of electronic signs in Bondi Beach's car park that read 'Swim & Go Access' and 'Surf & Go Access'.
item.title: Bondi Beach to be reopened for exercise as 'Swim n Go' signs hit car park

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: Companies that sharply increase debt levels are more likely to put their staff at risk by cutting corners, a study has found.
item.title: Risky business: Sharp debt increases can hit worker safety, study finds

item.description: Getting support will protect Australian consumers at a low cost, relative to the cost of a substantial loss in competition if Virgin fails.
item.title: The government should bail out Virgin, or consumers will suffer

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the week ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Wednesday, April 22

item.dc:creator: Kate Aubusson
item.description: From throat swab to high-tech lab and back again in under 24 hours. This is COVID-19 testing in Sydney.
item.title: Inside a COVID-19 test lab, where negative results are positive news

item.dc:creator: Kate Aubusson
item.description: Every Sydneysider will be tested and retested for coronavirus before the pandemic abates, as rapid and widespread detection emerges as a crucial factor for easing restrictions.
item.title: NSW Health says COVID-19 testing for anyone is inevitable

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: One of the country's biggest wealth managers MLC says it would consider investing superannuation money in collapsed airline Virgin Australia.
item.title: MLC chief won't rule out investing in Virgin

item.dc:creator: Sarah Danckert
item.description: "We are up for a fight," one bondholder says, adding how they are treated could throw a spanner in the works for the planned restructure.
item.title: Virgin's bond-holders could be a $1.8 billion thorn in restructure

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: It's far from perfect but Airtree Ventures partner James Cameron says the government's proposed COVID-19 contact tracing app doesn't pose a dire risk to user privacy.
item.title: Local tech leaders say contact tracing app will save lives

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Frasers Property Industrial has expanded its tenant base at the Horsley Park estate.
item.title: Frasers secures long-term lease with truck maker Hino

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: GPT Group and Australian Office Unity fund have defied current market jitters with expansion into the western Sydney office sector.
item.title: Office space expands in bustling Parramatta despite market jitters

item.description: The May 11 start date is one certainty in a sea of uncertainty.
item.title: Return to class is going to look very different from school to school

item.description: The Virgin business model was unsound and administration was only a matter of time.
item.title: No reasonable person could argue for a taxpayer bailout of Virgin

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: Pengana's ethical fund is one of many that have outperformed the index over the coronavirus-induced extreme market volatility.
item.title: 'Sustainability is the future': ESG funds outperform index

item.description: Richard Branson's business model is that someone else pays. He puts his name to things but other people put up the money.
item.title: Crash landing for airline living on a wing and a prayer

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: The argument that we should lift the coronavirus restrictions for the sake of the younger generation is nonsense and offensive.
item.title: Don't sacrifice the old, but we must repay our debt to the young

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: Vacancies have hit a record low in Melbourne's industrial south-east despite the coronavirus crisis.
item.title: Cold storage and dangerous goods driving demand for sheds

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: An investor has snapped up a childcare business at 1848 Geelong Road for $4,275,000.
item.title: Goodstart Early Learning centre sells

item.dc:creator: Garry Maddox
item.description: Now is the perfect time to catch up on the best books, films, television shows and podcasts you might have missed.
item.title: Top five: early gems from master filmmakers

item.description: Soviet diplomat Valery Ivanov was ordered out of Australia under suspicion of being a spy, partly because of his relationship with the former ALP national secretary, Mr David Combe.
item.title: From the Archives, 1983: Russian trips, champagne - and an ASIO tail

item.dc:creator: Helen Pitt
item.description: If Australia were to lift all restrictions in the pursuit of herd immunity we should expect cycling epidemics of COVID-19, increased absenteeism, and ultimately more deaths, one of Australia's leading pandemic experts has warned.
item.title: Herd immunity is a myth, infectious disease experts warn

item.description: Watching Aussies on social media nip down to the beach while "in iso" is hard.
item.title: I'm in France in lockdown and so jealous of Australia

item.dc:creator: Greg Growden
item.description: Dave Gilbert's 11th-hour humour helps conjure a classic victory for NSW in the Sheffield Shield final at the SCG.
item.title: From the archives, 1985: A day the Shield brought cricket back to life

item.dc:creator: Nick Miller
item.description: High school art teacher Karen Vincent sat down with her kids to recreate Blue Poles in Lego - the result has gone viral
item.title: An egg, a Pringle, some Lego: Aussies attempt DIY art masterpieces

item.description: To build an economy with a strong advanced manufacturing sector, we need to turn around the decline in the nation’s investment in research and development.
item.title: Time to revitalise our manufacturing sector

item.description: Just a glance at the Blues squad of that summer promised it would be a special season for NSW, perhaps even a marvellous summer.
item.title: Imran Khan, Steve Waugh and the spin triplets: NSW's golden summer of 1984-85

item.description: But "alone" and "lonely" are not synonymous.
item.title: I never wanted to get married. Now I'm alone in a pandemic

item.dc:creator: Kylar Loussikian
item.description: Energy Minister Angus Taylor’s long — and sometimes politically painful — association with the rural industry has come to an end.
item.title: Taylor packs up his swag and sells the farm

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: Treasury forecasting indicates the state's jobless rate will double and house prices slide as a result of the devastating economic impact of the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: 'Unprecedented in our lifetimes': Victoria issues grim economic warning

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: Some farmers have been unable to perform pest control because they have no ammunition, leading to an alarming number of sheep being killed by foxes.
item.title: 'We don't know what to do': Farmers, gun shop owners crippled by coronavirus gun ban

item.dc:creator: Mark Solomons
item.description: Three Labor-controlled states have restricted sales of guns and ammunition in response to the COVID-19 emergency, prompting a fierce reaction from lobby groups.
item.title: 'It's a political thing': Firearm industry fights coronavirus gun ban

item.dc:creator: Mark Solomons
item.description: Three Labor-controlled states have restricted sales of guns and ammunition as responses to the COVID-19 emergency, prompting a fierce reaction from lobby groups.
item.title: Coronavirus gun sales ban in Labor states opens new policy battleground

item.dc:creator: Aisha Dow
item.description: Grassroot organisers are urging governments to take seriously community efforts to produce hundreds of colourful protective gowns for medical workers.
item.title: Army of volunteer sewers could be the solution to gown shortages

item.dc:creator: Liam Mannix
item.description: A senior epidemiologist says official government modelling underestimates the true spread of COVID-19 in Australia.
item.title: Official COVID-19 figures underestimate spread by 'order of magnitude'

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Webb
item.description: Teenage trumpeter Benjamin Ball, whose great-grandfather died in World War II, will join musicians playing the Last Post from their driveways on Anzac Day.
item.title: 'It's such a part of Anzac Day': Musicians to play Last Post from home

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: As the day unfolded: Donald Trump to suspend immigration into US as COVID-19 economic fallout hits Virgin Australia, oil price, Australian death toll at 72

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Spending on roads in local council areas will be fast tracked in a bid to kick-start the economy after the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: Spending boost will bring forward construction for local councils

item.dc:creator: Noel Whittaker
item.description: Offers to reduce mortgage payments or defer them for six months are a ploy by lenders to collect interest on interest. If you have been paying more than the minimum amount, keep it up to save tens of thousands of dollars.
item.title: Why lenders don't mind if you cut your mortgage payments

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, April 22, 2020

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Researchers from Southern Cross University have captured footage of the dolphins regularly chasing fish up onto the muddy banks of the Fitzroy River.
item.title: These Queensland dolphins hunt on land as well as the water

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: It is understood fewer than 16 MPs will actually vote on legislation to ensure parliamentarians stay the recommended 1.5 metres away from one another in the chamber.
item.title: Queensland Parliament returns for mammoth day to pass emergency laws

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Australian remote learning startup EdApp has entered into a partnership with the United Nations, with ambitions of teaching hundreds of thousands of people around the world.
item.title: Australian online learning startup eyes global audience with UN tie-up

item.description: Many borrowers mistakenly believe Lender's Mortgage Insurance protects them if they default on a loan but only the lender benefits.
item.title: Mortgage insurance no protection in hard times

item.dc:creator: Noel Whittaker
item.description: Capital Gains Tax will be levied on the net increase in value from when it was rented. After application of the 50 per cent discount, it will be added to your taxable income in the year the sales contract was signed.
item.title: Cashing in an investment property to make super contributions

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: Economists, fund managers and industry bodies have all been unanimous in their message: Only draw down on your super as a last resort.
item.title: Why you should resist the urge to switch or redeem super

item.dc:creator: John Collett
item.description: Economists and analysts don't know what the likely future holds, but a quick economic recovery is probably the least likely.
item.title: Alphabet of economic recovery plots emerge from 'The Great Lockdown'
